page.title: 05Employment
page.content: Of necessity people here have to look outside the village for work. Farmers employ few local people, their labour being supplied by family members. There are a numer of self employed tradesmen, an electrician, builder, coal merchant, postmaster, grocer and some of the young farmers hit by the new milk quotas, have turned to other jobs to supplement their income. Forde Abbey with its large estate of woodlands, farms self pick fruit fields and tree nurseries employ some villagers at agricultural rates, whole others take jobs in the four surounding towns where there is established light industry and service shops. Some go as far as Taunton and Yeovil for their jobs. The age structure in the west is low and employers are in a strong negotiating position with prospective employees.
